TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MessageSecurityOverTcp extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Configures the message-level security for a message sent using the TCP transport.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This object is accessed from the binding by using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpBinding.Security%2A> property, which returns a <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpSecurity> object. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.NetTcpSecurity.Message%2A> property provides a reference to the MessageSecurityOverTcp object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Specifies the algorithm suite to be used for securing messages at the SOAP level.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You should be aware of the strengths and weaknesses of the relevant algorithms when making modifications to this setting.
If you set this property to a value other than the default and generate a configuration file using [ServiceModel Metadata Utility Tool (Svcutil.exe)](../Topic/ServiceModel%20Metadata%20Utility%20Tool%20\(Svcutil.exe\).md), it is not generated correctly and you must manually edit the configuration file to set the corresponding configuration attribute to the desired value.
## Examples The following code shows how to access and set this property.
[!code-cs[S_UEMessageSecurityOverTcp#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.me_6_1.cs)] [!code-vb[S_UEMessageSecurityOverTcp#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.me_6_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Specifies the type of client credential the client uses to authenticate itself to the service at the SOAP level.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The return value can be one of the following enumeration members:
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpClientCredentialType>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpClientCredentialType>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpClientCredentialType>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpClientCredentialType>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpClientCredentialType>
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpClientCredentialType>
## Examples The following code shows how to access and set this property.
[!code-cs[S_UEMessageSecurityOverTcp#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.servicemodel.me_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[S_UEMessageSecurityOverTcp#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.servicemodel.me_1_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: The value of ClientCredentialType is not a valid .
